item.title: Creating Your Custom Jupyter Kernel from a Virtual Environment
item.description: Creating a Python Kernel Admin Prerequisite Admin must enable conda for all users by creating a symlink. This will let users create their own virtual environment by using the conda create command. ln -s /opt/conda/bin/conda /usr/local/bin/conda User Instructions Users can launch a terminal session with either JupyterHub or RStudio or SSH connections. Launch a bash session. bash Users then can create a virtual environment in the following way. Note that specifying ipykernel package will make the user easily create jupyter kernels from that environment.
